titleInfo.subTitle: Betty L. Johnson oral history interview, 1997

name.description: Betty Johnson was born in April 1929 in Baton Rouge, La., to Thelma Ambeau Johnson and George E. Johnson Jr. She is a longtime member of Wesley United Methodist Church and at the time of this interview, was employed as an academic counselor at Southern University.

subject.topic: Wesley United Methodist Church (Baton Rouge, La.)

mods.abstract: Johnson describes her experiences as a congregant of Wesley United Methodist Church. She discusses the church's history and musical traditions, their support of higher education and partnerships with local universities, activities and retreats for church members, community outreach programs, involvement in the Civil Rights Movement and other topics. She talks about prominent former ministers, members and visitors to the church, and the role of women at Wesley.
